sen.j: 川勝 広綱（かわかつ ひろつな、天正7年（1579年） - 寛文元年9月12日 (旧暦)（1661年11月3日））は、安土桃山時代の武将、後に江戸時代初期の旗本。
sen.e: Hirotsuna KAWAKATSU (1579 - Nov 3, 1661) was a military commander during the Azuchi-Momoyama period and subsequently, a retainer of the Shogun during the Edo period.
Hirotsuna KAWAKATSU (1579 - Nov 3, 1661) was a military commander during the Azuchi-Momoyama period and subsequently, a retainer of the Shogun during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Hirotsuna KAWAKATSU (1579 - Nov 3, 1661) was a military commander during the Azuchi-Momoyama period and subsequently, a retainer of the Shogun during the Edo period.

sen.j: 秀氏流川勝家（本家）の2代当主。
sen.e: He was the 2nd hereditary leader of the 流川勝家 family (main family) in the Hata clan.
He was the second hereditary leader of the Kawakatsu family (main family) of Hideuji line.
sen.cmt: secondスペルアウトしました。秀氏流川勝家→Kawakatsu family of Hideuji line 煮訂正しました。in the Hata clan削除しました。
sen.e: He was the second hereditary leader of the Kawakatsu family (main family) of Hideuji line.

sen.j: 本姓は秦氏で、秦河勝の後裔とされる。
sen.e: His true family name was that of the Hata Clan and, he was a descendent of Hata no Kawakatsu.
His true family name was that of the Hata Clan and, he was a descendent of Hata no Kawakatsu.
His true family name was that of the Hata Clan and, he was a descendent of Hata no Kawakatsu.

sen.j: 通称は七九郎、新蔵。
sen.e: He was popularly known as Shichikuro or, 新蔵.
He was popularly known as Shichikuro or Shinzo.
He was popularly known as Shichikuro or Shinzo.

sen.j: 従五位下、信濃国守のち丹波国守。
sen.e: Holding a court rank of Jugoige (Lower Junior Fifth Rank) was the Governor of Shinshu and later on Tango provinces.
Holding a court rank of Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was the Governor of Shinano and later on Tanba Provinces.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。 (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) 煮訂正しました。Shinano and later on Tanba Provinces.に訂正しました。
sen.e: Holding a court rank of Jugoige (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was the Governor of Shinano and later on Tanba Provinces.

sen.j: 父は川勝秀氏。
sen.e: His father was Hideuji KAWAKATSU.
His father was Hideuji KAWAKATSU.
His father was Hideuji KAWAKATSU.

sen.j: 母は綾小路中納言の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of 綾小路中納言
His mother was the daughter of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Ayanokoji.
sen.cmt: 綾小路中納言→Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Ayanokojiピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Ayanokoji.

sen.j: 妻は藤掛永勝の娘。
sen.e: His wife was the daughter of Nagakatsu FUJIKAKE.
His wife was the daughter of Nagakatsu FUJIKAKE.
His wife was the daughter of Nagakatsu FUJIKAKE.

sen.j: 子に川勝広尚、川勝広氏、川勝広憲、養女（西洞院時直の娘、広綱に養われて藤堂将監嘉正の妻となる）、娘（佐久間信俊の妻）がいる。
sen.e: His children were: 川勝広尚, Hirouji KAWAKATSU, 川勝広憲,an adopted daughter (daughter of Tokinao Nishi no Tojin raised by Hirotsuna who became the wife of 藤堂将監嘉正) and a daughter (Nobutoshi SAKUMA`s wife).

His children were: Hironao KAWAKATSU, Hirouji KAWAKATSU, Hironori KAWAKATSU, an adopted daughter (daughter of Nishinotojin Tokinao raised by Hirotsuna who became the wife of Shokan Yoshimasa TODO) and a daughter (Nobutoshi SAKUMA's wife).
sen.cmt: 川勝広尚→Hironao KAWAKATSU川勝広憲→Hironori KAWAKATSUNishinotojin Tokinao に訂正しました。藤堂将監嘉正→Shokan Yoshimasa TODO全角の'を半角にしました。、を, に訂正しました。
sen.e: His children were: Hironao KAWAKATSU, Hirouji KAWAKATSU, Hironori KAWAKATSU, an adopted daughter (daughter of Nishinotojin Tokinao raised by Hirotsuna who became the wife of Shokan Yoshimasa TODO) and a daughter (Nobutoshi SAKUMA's wife).

sen.j: 天正7年（1579年）、川勝秀氏の嫡男として丹波に生まれた。
sen.e: In 1579, was born in Tamba Province as heir to Hideuji KAWAKATSU.
In 1579, Hirotsuna was born in Tanba Province as heir to Hideuji KAWAKATSU.
sen.cmt: Hirotsuna 補足しました。Tanbaに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1579, Hirotsuna was born in Tanba Province as heir to Hideuji KAWAKATSU.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の馬廻で、丹波国多紀郡内に200石、ついで近江国甲賀郡内に340石余を加増され、従五位下、信濃守に叙任された。
sen.e: In the role of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI`s umamawashi (mounted knight who rode close to the Shogun) he had a 200 koku domain within Takigun hamlet in Tanba Province.
In the role of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's umamawashi (mounted knight who rode close to the Shogun) he had a 200 koku domain within Taki-gun hamlet in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: In the role of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's umamawashi (mounted knight who rode close to the Shogun) he had a 200 koku domain within Taki-gun hamlet in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 後に近江国甲賀郡内の領地を、丹波国船井郡内に移された。
sen.e: Subsequently he swapped territory in Koga hamlet in Oumi Province for land in Funai hamlet in Tanba Province.
Subsequently he swapped territory in Koga hamlet in Omi Province for land in Funai hamlet in Tanba Province.
Subsequently he swapped territory in Koga hamlet in Omi Province for land in Funai hamlet in Tanba Province.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いでは、父秀氏とともに西軍に与して細川幽斎が拠る丹後国田辺城 (丹後国)攻撃（田辺城の戦い）に参加した。
sen.e: Together with his father Hideuji, during the Battle of Sekigaharara in 1601, he allied with the Western forces and participated in attacks on Yusai HOSOKAWA`s stronghold at Tanabe Castle (Tango Province) (Battle of Tanabe Castle).

Together with his father Hideuji, during the Battle of Sekigaharara in 1600, he allied with the Western forces and participated in attacks on Yusai HOSOKAWA's stronghold at Tanabe Castle in Tango Province (Battle of Tanabe Castle).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。1600に訂正しました。全角の’を半角にしました。in Tango Provinceに訂正しました。
sen.e: Together with his father Hideuji, during the Battle of Sekigaharara in 1600, he allied with the Western forces and participated in attacks on Yusai HOSOKAWA's stronghold at Tanabe Castle in Tango Province (Battle of Tanabe Castle).

sen.j: しかし、秀氏父子は徳川家康に赦され、改易を免れた（広綱は丹波国多紀郡・船井郡内から丹波国船井郡内に転封）。
sen.e: However, father and son were pardoned by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, demoted in rank (Hirotsuna was relocated from Takigun hamlet and Funaigun hamlets in Tamba Province to Funai Province).
However, father and son were pardoned by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, demoted in rank (Hirotsuna was relocated from Taki-gun hamlet and Funai-gun hamlets in Tanba Province to Funai Province).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。Tanbaに訂正しました。
sen.e: However, father and son were pardoned by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, demoted in rank (Hirotsuna was relocated from Taki-gun hamlet and Funai-gun hamlets in Tanba Province to Funai Province).

sen.j: 慶長6年（1601年）、室町期以来の丹波の旧族、細川忠興の推挙により召し出されて、父秀氏は旗本家を興した。
sen.e: In 1601 Hirotsuna`s father Hideuji was summoned at the behest of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA (of the ancient Tanba clan around since the Muromachi period) to form a vassal's household.
In 1601 Hirotsuna's father Hideuji was summoned at the behest of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA (of the ancient Tanba clan around since the Muromachi period) to form a vassal's household.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In 1601 Hirotsuna's father Hideuji was summoned at the behest of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA (of the ancient Tanba clan around since the Muromachi period) to form a vassal's household.

sen.j: 慶長11年（1606年）駿府城普請の命を受け、同年6月20日、勤めの褒賞として御書を給わった。
sen.e: In 1606 he received a decree to build Sunpu Castle and on June 20 the same year, received an meritorious service award certificate.
In 1606 he received a decree to build Sunpu Castle and on June 20 the same year, received an meritorious service award certificate.
In 1606 he received a decree to build Sunpu Castle and on June 20 the same year, received an meritorious service award certificate.

sen.j: 慶長12年（1607年）7月、父秀氏の家督を継いで、広綱は江戸幕府の旗本となった（知行は丹波内3,570石余）。
sen.e: In July 1607 he inherited the clan leadership role from his father Hideuji whereupon Hirotsuna became a vassal of the Edo shogunate (and a fief in Tanba Province of over 3,570 koku).
In July 1607 he inherited the clan leadership role from his father Hideuji whereupon Hirotsuna became a vassal of the Edo shogunate (and a fief in Tanba Province of over 3,570 koku).
In July 1607 he inherited the clan leadership role from his father Hideuji whereupon Hirotsuna became a vassal of the Edo shogunate (and a fief in Tanba Province of over 3,570 koku).

sen.j: 元和 (日本)3年（1617年）京都知恩院普請の奉行を勤めた。
sen.e: In 1617, he oversaw the construction of Chion-in Temple in Kyoto.
In 1617, he oversaw the construction of Chion-in Temple in Kyoto.
In 1617, he oversaw the construction of Chion-in Temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）使番となり、寛永10年（1633年）正月13日、命を受けて五畿内を巡見使した。
sen.e: In 1631 he became Tsukaiban (a person responsible for orders and patrol in a battlefield) and on Jan 13, 1633 received orders to go on an inspection tour of the 5 home provinces (Yamashiro, Yamato, Kawachi, Izumi, Settsu).)

In 1631 he became Tsukaiban (a person responsible for orders and patrol in a battlefield) and on February 21, 1633 received orders to go on an inspection tour of the 5 home provinces (Yamashiro, Yamato, Kawachi, Izumi, Settsu).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。不要な）を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1631 he became Tsukaiban (a person responsible for orders and patrol in a battlefield) and on February 21, 1633 received orders to go on an inspection tour of the 5 home provinces (Yamashiro, Yamato, Kawachi, Izumi, Settsu).

sen.j: 寛永11年（1634年）、将軍徳川家光の上洛に供奉し、寛永14年（1637年）9月12日、目付として豊後国府内藩に赴いた。
sen.e: In 1634 he accompanied the Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA on a tour of the capital and on Sep 12, 1637 as an inspector, he proceeded to the Funai domain in Bungo Province.
In 1634 he accompanied the Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA on a tour of the capital and on October 29, 1637 as an inspector, he proceeded to the Funai Domain in Bungo Province.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。Domain大文字にしました。
sen.e: In 1634 he accompanied the Shogun Iemitsu TOKUGAWA on a tour of the capital and on October 29, 1637 as an inspector, he proceeded to the Funai Domain in Bungo Province.

sen.j: 後にまた命を受け、たびたび府内に出かけた。
sen.e: Subsequently he received orders again and was absent from Funai.
Subsequently he received orders again and was absent from Funai.
Subsequently he received orders again and was absent from Funai.

sen.j: 寛永16年（1639年）10月15日、大和国高取藩に赴き、目付の仕事を務めた。
sen.e: On Oct 15, 1639 he proceeded to the Takatori domain in Yamato Province to serve as an inspector.
On November 10, 1639 he proceeded to the Takatori Domain in Yamato Province to serve as an inspector.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。Domain大文字にしました。
sen.e: On November 10, 1639 he proceeded to the Takatori Domain in Yamato Province to serve as an inspector.

sen.j: 寛永17年（1640年）高取城を植村家政に与えるため、現地で城引渡しの役を務めた。
sen.e: He took on the role on-site of handing over Takatori Castle which had been granted to Uemasa IEMURA.
In 1640, he took on the role on-site of handing over Takatori Castle which had been granted to Iemasa UEMURA.
sen.cmt: in 1640補足しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。Iemasa UEMURAに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1640, he took on the role on-site of handing over Takatori Castle which had been granted to Iemasa UEMURA.

sen.j: 寛永19年（1642年）4月、将軍家光の日光山の参詣に供奉した。
sen.e: In Apr 1642, he accompanied Shogun Iemitsu on his pilgrimage to Mt. Nikko-san.
In April 1642, he accompanied Shogun Iemitsu on his pilgrimage to Mt. Nikko-san.
sen.cmt: Aprilに訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In April 1642, he accompanied Shogun Iemitsu on his pilgrimage to Mt. Nikko-san.

sen.j: 寛永20年（1643年）11月朔日、池田光仲の領地である因幡国鳥取藩に出かけ、政務の監視をした。
sen.e: In early November 1642, he departed on an inspection tour of Mitsunaka IKEDA's Tottori domain in Inaba Province.
In early November 1643, he departed on an inspection tour of Mitsunaka IKEDA's Tottori Domain in Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 1643に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。Domainに訂正しました。
sen.e: In early November 1643, he departed on an inspection tour of Mitsunaka IKEDA's Tottori Domain in Inaba Province.

sen.j: 正保2年（1645年）松平忠昌が死去したため、同年8月16日に命を受けて越前国福井藩に出かけた。
sen.e: With the death of Tadamasu MATSUDAIRA in 1645, he received orders on August 16 and departed to do an inspection tour of the Fukui domain in Echizen Province.
With the death of Tadamasa MATSUDAIRA in 1645, he received orders on October 5 and departed to do an inspection tour of the Fukui Domain in Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。Domainに訂正しました。Tadamasaに訂正しました。
sen.e: With the death of Tadamasa MATSUDAIRA in 1645, he received orders on October 5 and departed to do an inspection tour of the Fukui Domain in Echizen Province.

sen.j: 慶安2年（1649年）永井直清に摂津国高槻城を与えるため、同年8月2日、命を受けて城引渡しの役を務めた。
sen.e: He received orders on August 2, 1649 to arrange a hand-over of Takatsuki Castle (located in Settsu Province) to Naokyo NAGAI that year.
He received orders on September 8, 1649 to arrange a hand-over of Takatsuki Castle (located in Settsu Province) to Naokiyo NAGAI that year.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。Naokiyoに訂正しました。
sen.e: He received orders on September 8, 1649 to arrange a hand-over of Takatsuki Castle (located in Settsu Province) to Naokiyo NAGAI that year.

sen.j: 慶安3年（1650年）閏10月17日、細川綱利が幼いため、その領地肥後国熊本藩に出かけ、政務を監視した。
sen.e: As Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA was still a child, he departed on October 17, 1650, on an inspection tour of Tsunatoshi`s domain and oversaw the affairs of the Kumamoto domain in Higo Province.
As Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA was still a child, he departed on December 10, 1650, on an inspection tour of Tsunatoshi's domain and oversaw the affairs of the Kumamoto Domain in Higo Province.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。全角の’を半角にしました。Domain大文字にしました、
sen.e: As Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA was still a child, he departed on December 10, 1650, on an inspection tour of Tsunatoshi's domain and oversaw the affairs of the Kumamoto Domain in Higo Province.

sen.j: 後に職を辞し、旗本寄合席に列した。
sen.e: Subsequently he retired from office took his place at shogunal vassal gatherings.
Subsequently he retired from office took his place at shogunal vassal gatherings.
Subsequently he retired from office took his place at shogunal vassal gatherings.

sen.j: 寛文元年（1661年）9月12日、83歳で没した。
sen.e: He died age 83 on Sep 12, 1661.
He died age 83 on Nobember 3, 1661.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: He died age 83 on Nobember 3, 1661.

sen.j: 法名は源正。
sen.e: He was given the posthumous Buddhist name of `源正`.
He was given the posthumous Buddhist name of 'Gensho.'
sen.cmt: 源正→Gensho としました。全角の’を半角にしました。
sen.e: He was given the posthumous Buddhist name of 'Gensho.'

sen.j: 墓所は（東京）芝の青龍寺。
sen.e: His grave is located in Shoryu-ji Temple in Shiba, Tokyo.
His grave is located in Shoryu-ji Temple in Shiba, Tokyo.
His grave is located in Shoryu-ji Temple in Shiba, Tokyo.

sen.j: 家督は広尚の嫡男の川勝広有が継いだ。
sen.e: The role of head of the family was inherited by 広尚`s heir Hiroari KAWAKATSU.
The role of head of the family was inherited by Hironao's heir Hiroari KAWAKATSU.
sen.cmt: 広尚→Hironao 全角の’を半角にしました。
sen.e: The role of head of the family was inherited by Hironao's heir Hiroari KAWAKATSU.

sen.j: また、二男の広氏は新たに旗本家を興した。
sen.e: Also, his second son Hiroji set up a new household.
Also, his second son Hirouji set up a new household.
Also, his second son Hirouji set up a new household.
